result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig R La Plant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

1:58 PM Defendant Craig R La Plant in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for Craig R La Plant.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
